    public class Zombie
extends ZombieActor
    A Zombie. This Zombie is pretty boring. It needs to be made more interesting.
    Author:
    ram

    • Method Detail

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove()
        Find out if the Zombie can move this turn
        Returns:
        a boolean, true if the Zombie can move, false otherwise

      • getIntrinsicWeapon

        public IntrinsicWeapon getIntrinsicWeapon()
        Description copied from class: Actor
        Creates and returns an intrinsic weapon. By default, the Actor 'punches' for 5 damage. Override this method to create an Actor with more interesting descriptions and/or different damage.
        Returns:
        a freshly-instantiated IntrinsicWeapon

      • getWeapon

        public Weapon getWeapon()
        Description copied from class: Actor
        Get the weapon this Actor is using. If the current Actor is carrying weapons, returns the first one in the inventory. Otherwise, returns the Actor's natural fighting equipment e.g. fists.
        Overrides:
        getWeapon in class Actor
        Returns:
        the Actor's weapon or natural

      • hurt

        public void hurt(int points)
        Do some damage to the current Zombie. Has a 25% chance of knocking off one of the Zombie's arms or legs.
        Overrides:
        hurt in class Actor
        Parameters:
        points - number of hitpoints to deduct.

      • playTurn

        public Action playTurn(Actions actions,
                       Action lastAction,
                       GameMap map,
                       Display display)
        If a Zombie can attack, it will. If not, it will chase any human within 10 spaces. If no humans are close enough it will wander randomly.
        Specified by:
        playTurn in class Actor
        Parameters:
        actions - list of possible Actions
        lastAction - previous Action, if it was a multiturn action
        map - the map where the current Zombie is
        display - the Display where the Zombie's utterances will be displayed
        Returns:
        the Action to be performed
